intro: Pseudognaphalium altamiranum, commonly known as the Mexican everlasting or golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces yellow to golden flower heads, which are composed of numerous tiny florets arranged in a compact cluster. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Pseudognaphalium altamiranum is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
